---
title: "Event-Driven vs Batch/Task-Oriented Architecture"
---

These two paradigms represent fundamentally different approaches to how data flows through a system. Let me break them down.

---

## Conceptual Overview

```
EVENT-DRIVEN ARCHITECTURE
==========================
                                         
  Producer(s)          Broker/Bus           Consumer(s)
  ┌─────────┐         ┌─────────┐         ┌─────────┐
  │ Service │─event──▶│  Queue  │─event──▶│ Service │
  │    A    │         │  Topic  │         │    X    │
  └─────────┘         │         │         └─────────┘
  ┌─────────┐         │         │         ┌─────────┐
  │ Service │─event──▶│         │─event──▶│ Service │
  │    B    │         └─────────┘         │    Y    │
  └─────────┘                             └─────────┘
       │                                       │
       └── Fire & Forget ──────────────────────┘
           (Asynchronous, Real-time)


BATCH/TASK-ORIENTED WORKFLOW
============================

  ┌──────────┐    ┌──────────┐    ┌──────────┐    ┌──────────┐
  │  Extract │───▶│Transform │───▶│   Load   │───▶│  Report  │
  │  (E)     │    │  (T)     │    │   (L)    │    │          │
  └──────────┘    └──────────┘    └──────────┘    └──────────┘
       │               │               │               │
       └───────────────┴───────────────┴───────────────┘
                  Scheduled / Triggered
                  (e.g., daily at 2 AM)
```

---

## Side-by-Side Comparison

| Aspect | Event-Driven | Batch/Task-Oriented |
|--------|--------------|---------------------|
| **Trigger** | Events (something happens) | Schedule or manual trigger |
| **Latency** | Near real-time (ms to sec) | High (minutes to hours) |
| **Data Volume per Operation** | Small (single record/event) | Large (bulk datasets) |
| **Coupling** | Loose (producers don't know consumers) | Tighter (pipeline dependencies) |
| **State Management** | Stateless or event-sourced | Often stateful between steps |
| **Failure Handling** | Retry per event, dead-letter queues | Retry entire job or checkpoint |
| **Complexity** | Higher (async debugging) | Lower (sequential logic) |

---

## When to Use Each

### Event-Driven Architecture — Best For:

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  USE EVENT-DRIVEN WHEN:                                     │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                             │
│  1. Real-time responses required                            │
│     • New DICOM image arrives → trigger AI inference        │
│     • User action → immediate notification                  │
│                                                             │
│  2. Decoupled microservices                                 │
│     • Service A shouldn't wait for Service B                │
│     • Teams deploy independently                            │
│                                                             │
│  3. Unpredictable, bursty workloads                         │
│     • ER imaging at night vs daytime                        │
│     • Scaling consumers up/down dynamically                 │
│                                                             │
│  4. Event sourcing / audit trails                           │
│     • Every state change is an immutable event              │
│     • Replay events to rebuild state                        │
│                                                             │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

**Radiology Example:**
```
New CT uploaded ──▶ [Event Bus] ──┬──▶ AI Triage Service
                                  ├──▶ PACS Notification
                                  └──▶ Worklist Update
```

### Batch/Task-Oriented — Best For:

```
┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│  USE BATCH WHEN:                                            │
├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤
│                                                             │
│  1. Large-scale data processing                             │
│     • Aggregate all studies from past month                 │
│     • Train/retrain ML models on historical data            │
│                                                             │
│  2. Complex transformations with dependencies               │
│     • ETL pipelines: Extract → Transform → Load             │
│     • Step B needs ALL of Step A's output                   │
│                                                             │
│  3. Cost optimization                                       │
│     • Run during off-peak hours                             │
│     • Bulk operations are cheaper than per-event            │
│                                                             │
│  4. Reporting & analytics                                   │
│     • Daily department statistics                           │
│     • Monthly quality metrics dashboard                     │
│                                                             │
└─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘
```

**Radiology Example:**
```
Daily 2 AM Job:
┌────────────┐   ┌────────────┐   ┌────────────┐   ┌────────────┐
│ Query PACS │──▶│De-identify │──▶│ Run QC     │──▶│ Update     │
│ for day's  │   │ & Export   │   │ checks     │   │ Research   │
│ studies    │   │            │   │            │   │ Database   │
└────────────┘   └────────────┘   └────────────┘   └────────────┘
```

## Hybrid Architecture (Common in Practice)

Most real-world systems combine both:

```
                    Real-time Path (Event-Driven)
                    ─────────────────────────────
DICOM          ┌─────────┐      ┌─────────────┐
Arrives ──────▶│  Kafka  │─────▶│ AI Inference│───▶ Alert
               │  Topic  │      │ Service     │
               └─────────┘      └─────────────┘
                    │
                    │ events persisted
                    ▼
               ┌─────────┐
               │  Data   │◀──── Raw storage
               │  Lake   │
               └─────────┘
                    │
                    │  Batch Path (Scheduled)
                    ─────────────────────────
                    ▼
            ┌──────────────┐    ┌──────────────┐
  Nightly:  │ Aggregate &  │───▶│ Train Model  │
            │ Feature Eng  │    │ Pipeline     │
            └──────────────┘    └──────────────┘
```

---

## Technology Examples

| Architecture | Common Tools |
|--------------|--------------|
| **Event-Driven** | Apache Kafka, RabbitMQ, AWS SQS/SNS, Google Pub/Sub, Redis Streams |
| **Batch/Task** | Apache Airflow, Prefect, Dagster, dbt, AWS Step Functions, cron jobs |
| **Hybrid** | Combine above (e.g., Kafka + Airflow) |
